markings: four untranslated characters, in blue, on bottom
medium: Imari ware, porcelain with underglaze blue and overglaze enamels and gold
text: The bold division of this bowl into symmetrical, but fancifully, delineated compartments around a central roundel is indicative of the fully developed Imari style of the late 17th century. Such wares were brought to Europe in great numbers by the Dutch East India Company where they were in high demand among British and Dutch collectors.
title: Bowl
